meanings.definition: To outlive or live longer than someone or something else.
meanings.sent1: My pet turtle may overlive me because they can live for many years.
meanings.sent2: I hope to overlive my great-grandparents and live a long, healthy life.
meanings.sent3: It would be funny if a tree could overlive a squirrel and watch generations of squirrels come and go.
meanings.sent4: The ancient oak seemed to overlive time itself, standing tall through centuries of change.
meanings.sent5: The idea of a vampire who could overlive all humans was both fascinating and terrifying.

meanings.definition: To survive or endure beyond a certain point.
meanings.sent1: Some plants can overlive harsh winters by going dormant until spring.
meanings.sent2: I wonder if our friendship can overlive this disagreement and remain strong.
meanings.sent3: It's like my old phone is trying to overlive its battery life, hanging on with just a few minutes of charge left.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to overlive the pain of her past was like a flame that refused to be extinguished.
meanings.sent5: The tiny seed managed to overlive the storm, growing into a beautiful flower despite the odds.
